newsitem.title: GERMANY: Lurgi eyes another satisfactory business year.
newsitem.headline: Lurgi eyes another satisfactory business year.

text.p: German engineering group Lurgi AG, a unit of Metallgesellschaft AG, said on Wednesday that it expected a satisfactory year in 1996/1997.
"The course of the first quarter has put us on course for a satisfactory business year," management board chairman Heinrich-Werner Mathes said at a news conference.
Mathes said pre-tax profits in 1995/96 reached 126.5 million marks, up from 113.3 million marks the previous year.
Turnover at the group in 1995/96 grew to 2.75 billion marks ($1.7 billion) from 1.5 billion the previous year, Lurgi said.
"As in the previous year all our business areas showed a profit," Mathes said.
